metadata.dc:author: Parrochia, Esteban
Wolff, Carlos
Berríos, Marcela
Franco, Carmen
Armas-Merino, Rodolfo
metadata.dc:description: We report a 67 years old woman admitted to the hospital for the study of a cholestatic jaundice and massive hepatomegaly. On admission, the patient did not have liver failure. During hospital stay, the patient experienced a progressive deterioration of liver function and a monoclonal gammopathy was detected. An IgG Kappa myeloma-was diagnosed. A fine needle liver biopsy disclosed the presence of amyloid. The patient developed acute liver failure and died three weeks after admission.
metadata.dc:title: Insuficiencia hepática aguda en amiloidosis hepática asociada a mieloma múltiple. Caso clínico.
[Acute Liver Failure in patient with liver amyloidosis associated to multiple myeloma].
